revised_title: Effects of Lesions in Different Regions of the Cerebral Hemispheres
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on monkeys to study the effects of lesions in different regions of the cerebral hemispheres. They found that removing the left occipital lobe did not affect vision, while damaging the prefrontal regions led to changes in behavior and mental state. These findings contributed to the understanding of the brain's structure and function.
